name: electricity production, wind, 1-3MW turbine, onshore | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20862/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity at onshore grid-connected wind power plants with capacities ranging between 1-3 MW in Argentina in 2014. The operative wind power plants of this size during that year were: Arauco, Loma Blanca, Rawson and Tordillo, with a net electricity production of 0.58 TWh All of them are placed onshore. ;;The exchanges and parameters for electricity production have been taken from the “electricity production, wind, <1 MW turbine, onshore, GLO, 2008” dataset (accessed: February 2nd, 2018). ;Wind load hours have been calculated from the electricity production volume and the installed capacity;The dataset includes operation and maintenance expenditures as well as infrastructure inputs. "This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity at onshore grid-connected wind power plants with a capacity between 1 (excluded) and 3 (included) MW Argentina in 2014. It includes operation and maintenance expenditures as well as infrastructure inputs. Wind load hours have been adapted to local conditions (see parameters). ;At the moment, the class of onshore 1-3MW wind turbines is approximated with a 2 MW onshore wind turbine consisting  of the infrastructure datasets for the 'wind turbine construction' and the 'network connection construction'. The wind turbine's parts are defined to be everything except for the network connection, i.e. rotor, nacelle, tower, and foundation.;According to The Wind Power Database (2014), total installed wind capacity on-and offshore Argentina in the end of 2014 amounted to 184,4 MW. According to The Wind Power Database (2014), total installed wind capacity on-and offshore in Argentina in the end of 2014 amounted to 271 MW. Out of it, 0% were installed offshore, which are modelled with a 2 MW wind turbine. However, according to CAMMESA during 2014  only 191 MW were operative:  <1MW 3.43 %; 1-3MW 96,57 %. Source: CAMMESA "COMPAÑÍA ADMINISTRADORA DEL MERCADO MAYORISTA ELÉCTRICO SOCIEDAD ANÓNIMA" Informe anual 2014. Supporting documentation available at: http://portalweb.cammesa.com/Memnet1/default.aspx NOTE: This is the installed capacity per the end of the year 2014 as given by CAMMESA, which is then set into relation with the amount of electricity produced in 2014. 

From operation of the wind power plant to high voltage electricity at the plant. The electricity produced with wind turbines in a wind power plant is connected to medium voltage or high voltage systems, depending on the size of the windfarm. Normally, each wind turbine contains a transformer from low voltage to medium voltage. The network connection additionally transforms the electricity to high voltage electricity. It is assumed here, that there are no stand-alone grid-connected small wind turbines and that all electricity is connected to the network in form of high voltage electricity. 



This activity ends with the production of 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and delivered to the grid.

This dataset includes 
 - the operation and maintenance of the wind power plant
 - change of lubricating oil every year

This dataset doesn't include 
 - raw materials extraction, decommissioning and waste treatment as these activities are already included in infrastructure datasets
 - transformation of the electricity produced in order to deliver in to the grid as this is already included in the infrastructure datasets.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Technology of a 2MW Vestas V80 wind power plant modelled with a dataset for the wind turbine (moving+fixed parts) and a network connection each.;See dataset 'wind turbine construction, 2MW, onshore' for detailed technical information.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
The net electricity production volume have been calculated for Argentina for this specific wind power plant class
The parameter “use of lubricating oil for maintenance”has been taken from the "electricity production, wind, 1-3MW turbine, onchore"/GLO 2008 dataset (accessed: February 2nd, 2018), and extrapolated from the 800 kW turbine in (Burger & Bauer 2007) (63 kg per year) with the rate of capacities. The exchange “lubricating oil” has been calculated from that figure..
The exchanges "Energy, kinetic (in wind), converted" and "transport, freight, lorry 7.5-16 metric ton, EURO3" have been taken from the original dataset
The wind load hours have been calculated for this wind power plant class, considering the gross electricity production from this wind power plant class, the gross to net losses and the total on-shore installed capacity
The remaining exchanges and parameters have been calculated and/or extrapolated for Argentina
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
This dataset is based on electricity produced in the following wind power plants: 
PARQUE EOLICO ARAUCO II SAPEM
PARQUE EOLICO ARAUCO SAPEM
C.EOLICA LOMA BLANCA IV-ENARSA
P.EOLICO RAWSON I - ENARSA
P.EOLICO RAWSON II - ENARSA
CE EL TORDILLO-VIENTO PATAGON

During the reference year the total operative installed capacity of this wind power plant class was 184.4 MW, while theiir total net electricity production was 583622.7 MWh

Source: CAMMESA "COMPAÑÍA ADMINISTRADORA DEL MERCADO MAYORISTA ELÉCTRICO SOCIEDAD ANÓNIMA"Supporting documentation available at: http://portalweb.cammesa.com/Memnet1/default.aspxNOTE: "
